messages.title: Election latest
messages.content: The election across Portsmouth South is looking like it's going to be neck and neck between the Liberal Democrats and the Conservatives.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: New school places opposed by Conservatives.

3 broken promises from the Conservatives: 1) The Prime Minister broke his promise to bring our railways back to British ownership. 2) The Conservatives broke trust to protect all our police officers. 3) The Conservatives took free TV licences from social security recipients over 75 and want to reintroduce a prescription tax of £10,000 for tying up the NHS.
Create high quality jobs and bring training to the city.
Clean up city streets by introducing on the spot fines for littering or failing to clean up dog mess.

mentions.candidate: Gerald Vernon-Jackson has over ten years of fighting for Portsmouth
mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour are 20/1 outsiders, everyone knows that UKIP and the Greens can't win in Portsmouth South. A vote for any other party than the Liberal Democrats will just help the Conservatives win.

issues.economy: Stop charging pensioners and teenagers for the ferry, increasing jobs. Create high quality jobs and training to the city.
issues.education: New school places opposed by Conservatives.
issues.environment: Clean up city streets with on the spot fines for litter or failing to clean up dog mess.
issues.health: The Conservatives took free TV licences from social security recipients over 75 and want to reintroduce a prescription tax of £10,000 for tying up the NHS.

politicalExperience.achievements: Last person to be local councillor.

endorsements.endorsement: Gerald and Jason will be brilliant for this area. Gerald will be a superb MP and Jason will be a great councillor.

images.caption: Jason Fazackarley and Gerald Vernon-Jackson on a local campaign trail.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet includes maps highlighting areas where the candidates have worked or campaigned for local residents. It also includes comparisons of voting percentage chances between different parties.
